Ramrao Desai | bgcolor="" | | Bharatiya Janata Party || 369 | |- | 38 || Quepem || Prakash Velip | bgcolor="" | | Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party || 369 | |- | 39 || Canacona || Sanjay Bandekar | bgcolor="" | | Indian National Congress || 171 | |- | 40 || Poinguinim || Isidore Fernandes | bgcolor="" | | Independent || 1,659 | |- |} == Government formation == Indian National Congress formed the government under the leadership of Luizinho Faleiro which lasted for 169 days. Francisco Sardinha broke the Indian National Congress and formed government with the help of Bharatiya Janata Party which lasted for 334 days. On 24 October 2000, Bharatiya Janata Party formed its first government in Goa under the leadership of Manohar Parrikar which lasted for 1 year and 223 days before next elections where called off. ==References== Category:State Assembly elections in Goa Category:1990s in Goa Category:1999 State Assembly elections in India
title: 1999 Goa Legislative Assembly election
